sourcesContent:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { useParams, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import './CourseDetail.css'; const CourseDetail = () => { const { id } = useParams(); const [course, setCourse] = useState(null); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); useEffect(() => { // Fetch course data based on ID const fetchCourse = () => { setLoading(true); // In a real application, this would be an API call // For now, we'll use our predefined course data const courseDetails = getCourseDetails(parseInt(id)); if (courseDetails) { setCourse(courseDetails); } setLoading(false); }; fetchCourse(); }, [id]); const getCourseDetails = (courseId) => { const coursesData = { 1: { id: 1, title: 'Introduction to Programming', description: 'Learn the basics of programming with this introductory course. Perfect for beginners who want to start their coding journey.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Programming+Basics', fullDescription: `

Introduction to Programming

This foundational course is designed for absolute beginners with no prior programming experience. You'll learn the essential concepts that apply across all programming languages.

What You'll Learn

  • Core programming concepts: variables, data types, operators, and expressions
  • Control structures: conditionals and loops
  • Functions and modular programming
  • Basic algorithms and problem-solving techniques
  • Introduction to object-oriented programming principles

Course Structure

The course consists of 8 modules, each building on the previous one. You'll complete hands-on coding exercises and small projects to reinforce your learning.

Prerequisites

No prior programming experience is required. Basic computer skills and logical thinking abilities are helpful.

`, duration: '8 weeks', level: 'Beginner', instructor: 'Dr. Sarah Johnson' }, 2: { id: 2, title: 'Web Development Fundamentals', description: 'Discover the core concepts of web development including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build modern websites.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Web+Development', fullDescription: `

Web Development Fundamentals

This comprehensive course will teach you the three core technologies that power the modern web: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. By the end, you'll be able to create responsive, interactive websites from scratch.

What You'll Learn

  • HTML5 structure and semantics
  • CSS3 styling, layouts, and responsive design
  • JavaScript fundamentals and DOM manipulation
  • Web accessibility principles
  • Version control with Git
  • Deploying your first website

Course Structure

This 10-week course combines lectures with hands-on projects. You'll progressively build a portfolio website that showcases your skills as you learn.

Prerequisites

Basic computer skills and familiarity with using web browsers. No prior coding experience required, but our "Introduction to Programming" course is recommended.

`, duration: '10 weeks', level: 'Beginner', instructor: 'Prof. Michael Chen' }, 3: { id: 3, title: 'Database Design', description: 'Master the principles of database design and learn how to create efficient, normalized database structures.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Database+Design', fullDescription: `

Database Design

Learn how to design, implement, and optimize relational databases. This course covers both theoretical concepts and practical skills needed to work with database systems in real-world applications.

What You'll Learn

  • Relational database fundamentals
  • Entity-Relationship modeling
  • Normalization techniques (1NF through 5NF)
  • Structured Query Language (SQL)
  • Database indexing and optimization
  • Transaction management and concurrency control
  • Introduction to NoSQL databases

Course Structure

The course combines theoretical lectures with practical lab sessions using popular database systems like MySQL and PostgreSQL. You'll design and implement a complete database system for a case study application.

Prerequisites

Basic understanding of programming concepts. Our "Introduction to Programming" course would provide sufficient background.

`, duration: '8 weeks', level: 'Intermediate', instructor: 'Dr. Lisa Rodriguez' }, 4: { id: 4, title: 'Mobile App Development', description: 'Build cross-platform mobile applications using modern frameworks and best practices.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Mobile+Development', fullDescription: `

Mobile App Development

This practical course teaches you how to develop mobile applications that work seamlessly across iOS and Android platforms using React Native, one of the most popular cross-platform frameworks in the industry.

What You'll Learn

  • React Native fundamentals
  • Component-based architecture
  • State management with Redux
  • Navigation and routing
  • Accessing device features (camera, location, etc.)
  • API integration and data fetching
  • Testing and debugging mobile applications
  • Publishing to app stores

Course Structure

This hands-on course will guide you through building progressively complex applications. By the end, you'll develop a fully functional mobile app that you can add to your portfolio.

Prerequisites

Familiarity with JavaScript and basic programming concepts. Our "Web Development Fundamentals" course would provide excellent preparation.

`, duration: '12 weeks', level: 'Intermediate', instructor: 'Alex Thompson' }, 5: { id: 5, title: 'Machine Learning Basics', description: 'Explore the fundamentals of machine learning algorithms and their applications in real-world scenarios.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Machine+Learning', fullDescription: `

Machine Learning Basics

This course provides a comprehensive introduction to machine learning concepts and techniques. You'll learn to implement, train, and evaluate various machine learning algorithms using Python and popular libraries.

What You'll Learn

  • Supervised vs. unsupervised learning
  • Classification, regression, and clustering algorithms
  • Feature engineering and selection
  • Model evaluation and validation techniques
  • Overfitting, underfitting, and regularization
  • Introduction to neural networks
  • Practical implementation with scikit-learn and TensorFlow

Course Structure

Each week covers different algorithms and techniques. You'll complete programming assignments and a final project applying machine learning to solve a real-world problem.

Prerequisites

Python programming experience and basic understanding of statistics and linear algebra. We recommend completing our "Introduction to Programming" course if you're new to coding.

`, duration: '10 weeks', level: 'Intermediate to Advanced', instructor: 'Dr. Robert Zhang' }, 6: { id: 6, title: 'Cloud Computing', description: 'Learn how to leverage cloud platforms for scalable and resilient application deployment.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Cloud+Computing', fullDescription: `

Cloud Computing

Master the fundamentals of cloud computing and learn to design, deploy, and manage applications in cloud environments. This course focuses primarily on AWS, with conceptual coverage of other major platforms.

What You'll Learn

  • Cloud computing concepts and service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)
  • AWS core services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda)
  • Cloud architecture design principles
  • Containerization with Docker
  • Orchestration with Kubernetes
  • Serverless computing
  • Cloud security best practices
  • Cost optimization strategies

Course Structure

The course combines theory with extensive hands-on labs. You'll progressively build and deploy a cloud-native application, implementing various services as you learn them.

Prerequisites

Basic understanding of networking concepts, Linux command line, and programming fundamentals.

`, duration: '10 weeks', level: 'Intermediate', instructor: 'Emily Richards' }, 7: { id: 7, title: 'Cybersecurity Essentials', description: 'Understand the core principles of cybersecurity and how to protect systems from common threats.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=Cybersecurity', fullDescription: `

Cybersecurity Essentials

This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the critical field of cybersecurity. You'll learn about common threats, defensive strategies, and the mindset needed to protect information systems.

What You'll Learn

  • Cybersecurity fundamentals and threat landscape
  • Network security principles
  • Authentication and access control
  • Cryptography basics
  • Web application security
  • Security operations and incident response
  • Social engineering and human factors
  • Security governance and compliance

Course Structure

The course combines theory with practical exercises in a safe, controlled environment. You'll participate in security assessments, vulnerability analysis, and defense planning activities.

Prerequisites

Basic understanding of computer networks and operating systems. Some programming knowledge is helpful but not required.

`, duration: '8 weeks', level: 'Beginner to Intermediate', instructor: 'David Wilson' }, 8: { id: 8, title: 'Data Structures and Algorithms', description: 'Master essential data structures and algorithms needed for efficient problem solving in programming.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=DS+and+Algorithms', fullDescription: `

Data Structures and Algorithms

This course covers fundamental data structures and algorithms that form the foundation of computer science. You'll learn how to analyze, implement, and optimize algorithms to solve complex programming problems efficiently.

What You'll Learn

  • Algorithm analysis and Big O notation
  • Arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues
  • Trees, heaps, and graphs
  • Hash tables and dictionaries
  • Searching and sorting algorithms
  • Recursion and dynamic programming
  • Greedy algorithms
  • Problem-solving strategies for technical interviews

Course Structure

Each week introduces new data structures and algorithms with theoretical explanations and practical implementations. You'll solve algorithmic problems and complete programming assignments that reinforce the concepts.

Prerequisites

Solid programming experience in at least one language (preferably Python, Java, or C++). Our "Introduction to Programming" course is a prerequisite.

`, duration: '12 weeks', level: 'Intermediate', instructor: 'Prof. James Kumar' }, 9: { id: 9, title: 'DevOps Practices', description: 'Learn modern DevOps methodologies to streamline software development and deployment processes.', image: 'https://via.placeholder.com/800x400?text=DevOps', fullDescription: `

DevOps Practices

This practical course teaches you the principles, tools, and practices of DevOps to improve collaboration between development and operations teams and streamline the software delivery pipeline.

What You'll Learn

  • DevOps culture and principles
  • Version control with Git and GitHub
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform
  • Configuration management with Ansible
  • Containerization with Docker
  • Container orchestration with Kubernetes
  • Monitoring, logging, and observability

Course Structure

This hands-on course guides you through setting up a complete DevOps pipeline for a sample application. You'll work on practical exercises that mirror real-world scenarios.

Prerequisites

Basic understanding of programming, command line, and system administration concepts. Familiarity with Linux is highly recommended.

`, duration: '10 weeks', level: 'Intermediate to Advanced', instructor: 'Sophia Martinez' } }; return coursesData[courseId] || null; }; if (loading) { return
Loading...
; } if (!course) { return
Course not found!
; } return (

{course.title}

Duration: {course.duration}
Level: {course.level}
Instructor: {course.instructor}
Back to Courses
); }; export default CourseDetail;
